clinical_study.brief_title: Predict the Risk of Axillary Metastases in Breast Cancer Patients With Axillary Ultrasound
clinical_study.official_title: A Nomogram to Predict the Risk of Axillary Metastases in Breast Cancer Patients With Axillary Ultrasound

lead_sponsor.agency: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: Axillary lymph node status is a vital prognostic factors in breast cancer patients and provides crucial information for making treatment decisions.This projective observational study is planned to identify risk factors for axillary metastases in breast cancer patients with axillary ultrasound and to construct a nomogram to predict the risk of axillary metastases in these patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Breast carcinoma is the most common malignancy in women, accounting for 25% of all female cancer cases and 15% of all cancer-related deaths in the world.Lymph node metastasis is a multifactorial event. Among patients with a preoperative axillary ultrasound, almost 40% of patients are pathologically proved to be free from axillary metastasis.The purpose of this study is to develop a nomogram to evaluate the probability of axillary metastasis as a tool to support clinical decision-making.

primary_outcome.description: Surgical treatment for breast cancer patients include breast-conserving surgery or mastectomy with or without breast reconstruction. Intraoperative ALND is carried out when the SLNs are positive by intraoperative frozen section. Post-operative H&E permanent staining is administered to confirm the results of the frozen section. Serial H&E and immunohistochemistry stain (IHC) are only carried out when axillary metastases are not visible after H&E staining.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- female patients with primary breast cancer
- receiving a successful SLNB or ALND
- pathological diagnosed, without distant metastasis
- a clinically negative axilla
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- neoadjuvant therapy
- previous ipsilateral axillary surgery
- inflammatory breast cancer
